lexUnit.name: bowl.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained by a round, deep dish or basin

sentence.text: They would go to one another 's flats , have supper in a bistro , go to a film , or sit at home with bowls of spaghetti , chatting and watching television .
The captain gave him a bowl of cold stew which he could only swallow by gulping it down with wine .
In the good old days , Eskimos used to wash their hair in urine and share a bowl of seal blood .
There was a man here once , he could take half an hour to drink a bowl of soup , big as an ox .
They stopped chatting as Stephen and James came out onto the terrace , Stephen carrying a tray of drinks and James two bowls of nuts and crisps .
Then she roused the two children , urging them to be quiet , and to quickly wash , dress , and eat a bowl of cornflakes .
They ate huge bowls of steaming spaghetti carbonara beneath dusty Chianti bottles in an unfashionable Sicilian restaurant behind the Royal Opera House .
With a feeling of being ill-used she started to clear up the remains of last night 's dinner , while drinking a freshly squeezed orange juice , then eating a bowl of cereal .
The Lord Llewellyn , sitting beneath a brocade canopy and eating a bowl of figs , eyed the pageant with a mixture of amusement and contempt .
Eleanor Thorne would have enjoyed a bowl of soup .
He made periodic dives at the bowl of cherries poised on a coffee table by the sofa .
We used to make great bowls of raw onions soaked in vinegar and sugar .
We then had a bowl of fruit salad , and there was change from the price of a glass of beer .
Had he not had a bowl of water in his cell , he too , would have succumbed before his rescuers found him .
They would work more effectively , Dr Benton says , if they all had a bowl of cereal , a slice of toast or a bacon sandwich first thing .
Again , while Nicholas was having breakfast he kept getting down from his place , and his mother followed him round with a bowl of cereal , feeding him with a spoonful whenever she could .
We get a bowl of cereal , and a plate with sausage , egg and single piece of bacon .
Research shows that something as simple as a bowl of cornflakes can improve moods dramatically , one researcher saying that the dose of carbohydrate acted on women like a tranquilliser .
Minutes later she was in the kitchen , frantically preparing a pot of tea , slices of toast and three bowls of cornflakes .
I eat tremendous amounts of bread and jam and bowls of cornflakes with cold milk -- delicious !
With hot , sizzling barbecued food , serve large bowls of salad , pasta tossed with herby tomato sauce or olive oil , chopped basil and pine nuts .
After three hours of continuous nibbling it seemed , I will confess , rather on the acid and insubstantial side , and I began to yearn for a bowl of pasta .
The lads were having lunch at the time and when ` Jacki " leaned over to shake hands with Peter Grant , his tie fell into a bowl of soup .
Lefevre finished his bowl of soup in uncouth but effective manner , gripping it in both hands and pouring the remaining contents down his throat at a gulp .
He looked desperately around for a weapon , picked up a bowl of hot soup and threw it at Edgar , who started screaming .
` The Reverend Father , " Athelstan replied smoothly , ` would like a bowl of thick leek soup , some bread , and a cup of wine with more water than claret . "
Purposely pressing the button implying ` fat in five seconds " pills , she held out the bowl of soup and let a small , white pill drop in .
